item.title: 245 – Prayer
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Prayer Having rowed all night into a wind of my own making I slip at last over the gunwale into Your waters exhausted uncaring I mar the calm and plunge into the drowning that brings death in life, my lungs … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Prayer

Having rowed all night
into a wind
of my own making
I slip at last
over the gunwale
into Your waters
exhausted uncaring
I mar the calm
and plunge into the drowning
that brings death
in life, my lungs filled
to bursting

item.title: 244 – Patio
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Patio It happens likes this: the parable about being one flesh kicks up as I sweep the driveway some late morning, fine dirt dusting into the grass. The precise intentional edge laid against chaos of the living earth and all … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Patio

It happens likes this:
the parable about being
one flesh kicks up
as I sweep the driveway
some late morning, fine dirt
dusting into the grass.
The precise intentional
edge laid against chaos
of the living earth and all
it entails. I lean on my broom
in the warmth of September
puzzling out just which
one of us is which
right then, which one we are
slowly becoming.

item.title: 243 – the dry time
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: the dry time leave the city before rain comes split the juniper wide open to chew its spiced meat a rock on the tongue cuts thirst smell the sage, alfalfa sweet grass burn out west dark clouds nuzzle the mtn … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
the dry time

leave the city before
rain comes

split the juniper wide open
to chew its spiced meat

a rock on the tongue cuts
thirst

smell the sage, alfalfa
sweet grass burn

out west dark clouds nuzzle
the mtn

cool wet wind
itches

the dry time, sand in shoes
and dusty maps

chapped kisses zinging
like heat lightening

late nights out
gin cracking cubes

cicada songs hums
up under skin

over, turned
like a stone

in soft dirt
worms squiggling

among winter squash
trumpeting their arrival

soon: cling of wool
soon: fires moved indoors

soon: the harvest moon
rolls around again

soon: peat smoke
smoldering dark dreams

of whiskey plums
fallen leaves piled

to rot of the crack
of thunder

and open skies
pouring out and out

item.title: 242 – Fish Creek Mtn.
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Fish Creek Mtn. Two abreast in one wet tent miles to go in the morning without ever knowing what loon lives on this lake. We hurl ourselves into the created world to contend with it as men and women made … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Fish Creek Mtn.

Two abreast
in one wet tent
miles to go in the morning
without ever knowing
what loon lives
on this lake.

We hurl ourselves
into the created world
to contend with it
as men and women made
of dust. Again and again

We are defeated
in the same instant
we are glorified.
A shroud of mist
on the lake. Rainsong
trickling down

Sound reminder
of what we are
of what we are not.
Kneel at the altar of fire,
baptized in its smoke.

item.title: 241 – Crickets
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Crickets What’s sadder: the crickets’ song ignored at the “expense” of writing a poem or the poem neglected all day, left til last lights? The song goes silent as goes the poem.
item.content:encoded:
Crickets

What’s sadder: the crickets’
song ignored
at the “expense” of writing
a poem or the poem neglected
all day, left til last lights?

The song goes silent
as goes the poem.

item.title: 240 – #TBT
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: #TBT No photos but stories pulled out of the air at the picnic table. Pints help. Lore carried for years, spun like sugar gone hard at the back of the drawer. It’ll break your jaw if you bite too hard. … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
#TBT

No photos but stories
pulled out of the air
at the picnic table.
Pints help. Lore
carried for years, spun
like sugar gone hard
at the back of the drawer.
It’ll break your jaw
if you bite too hard.
Let it dissolve into the blood
as the best stories do. Sharp cystals
cut a little, mainlining
straight to the ticker. Sticks
and stones and breaking bones.
And above it all that big rock candy
mountain looming.

item.title: 239 – Vamoose
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Vamoose Christ had this nifty trick of slipping away just when he was about to have his head caved in or get himself hurled off a cliff by the local talent. What luck. Or gift of the Spirit, I suppose, … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Vamoose

Christ had this nifty trick
of slipping away just when
he was about to have his head caved in
or get himself hurled off a cliff
by the local talent.

What luck. Or gift
of the Spirit, I suppose, given
he’s the giver and keeper
of such things. Spirited away,
isn’t that what we say
to mean poof?

Vamoose! And so he did
at the exact right
and wrong moments,
at least from where I’m standing.
Held out when he shoulda folded.
And good thing.

Not me, though. I mostly want the wind
to make a ghost on the hilltop,
slip off unnoticed, leave them
looking around, wondering
just where it was I went to. Taken,
maybe, up into the clouds.

item.title: 238 – Seize
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Seize is the one thing you can’t do the aura lit you up like sheet lightening but softer, a breeze kissed with fire then darkness I watched your eyes dim roll wild pupils stolen lost on the edge of the … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Seize

is the one thing
you can’t do

the aura lit you up
like sheet lightening

but softer, a breeze
kissed with fire

then darkness

I watched
your eyes dim

roll wild
pupils stolen

lost on the edge
of the tub

your rigid body
reaching out

I was the only one left
to seize

(h/t JC for the inspiration)

item.title: 237 – Oh, God
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Oh, God Oh, God, why, we’ve all got our struggles, don’t we? My uncle’s a career alcoholic and sometimes I work too hard. This is just your cross to bear. But hey! Some of my best work friends are gay … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Oh, God

Oh, God, why,
we’ve all got our struggles,
don’t we?

My uncle’s a career alcoholic
and sometimes I work too hard.
This is just your cross to bear.

But hey!
Some of my best work friends
are gay and they seem fine.

You’ll be great. Just don’t
take the Body in your sodomite mouth
(if they’ll let you).

Kidding, kidding! But really:
please stick to the grape juice
and don’t drink directly from the Cup.

There are others
to think about,
don’t you know.

item.title: 236 – Horizon
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Horizon It’s your dread pirate-self I see wilding beard plaited, tied up with a blue bow of China silk astern some sea-going vessel bearing your wide-legged body out onto the dark wheel I have no mind for sextants of the … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Horizon

It’s your dread pirate-self I see
wilding beard plaited, tied up
with a blue bow of China silk
astern some sea-going vessel
bearing your wide-legged body
out onto the dark wheel

I have no mind for sextants
of the faint telemetry of stars

So quick you are to become a speck
lost at sea I worry up monsters
buried in some trench of dreams
though what’s worse: you
worry them ever greater, lurking
together under Orion’s sword
